body_html:
Hi @eaplatanios,
As @ispirmustafa said, the API supports different inputs for training and infrerence, as well as different outputs. E.g. during training the output is typically the loss, whereas for inference we can return e.g. probabilities for all classes, or top-k classes.

But you mention the case of sequence models, such as translation. We did not touch this use case yet. Do you think the API is compatible with those models? If not, we are interested about what are the specific blockers.

But you mention the case of sequence models, such as translation. We did not touch this use case yet. Do you think the API is compatible with those models? If not, we are interested about what are the specific blockers.
body:
Hi @eaplatanios,
As @ispirmustafa said, the API supports different inputs for training and infrerence, as well as different outputs. E.g. during training the output is typically the loss, whereas for inference we can return e.g. probabilities for all classes, or top-k classes.

But you mention the case of sequence models, such as translation. We did not touch this use case yet. Do you think the API is compatible with those models? If not, we are interested about what are the specific blockers.
